message: Passing a URL  argument as a string variable gives different results than passing an argument as a hand typed string. If that makes any sense
We use that library at work but I haven't seen that bug.  Can you paste a repro somewhere?
I'ce heard the python-sdk from facebook is broken at this time.
It's not worth even looking at. It doesn't even have a license.
It's easy enough to wrap the graph api manually.
What about authentication? I struggled to find a workflow for desktop apps but couldn't come up with anything workable. Their web stuff seems horrendously clunky and badly documented (to me, anyway).
the official facebook python-sdk is an atrocity, unfortunately I always found it easier to just do it by hand (both auth and graph api)
just look at this bug report with which I couldn't agree more: https://github.com/facebook/python-sdk/issues/58
